messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserPostController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\UserPostController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full path:
  /v1/users/{user}/posts

- all HTTP methods acceptable: false

- HEAD: true
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- The routes file registers a prefixed group Route::prefix('v1')->group(...). Inside it, Route::apiResource('users.posts', UserPostController::class)->only('index') defines the nested resource route for posts on a given user. The nested resource pattern produces the URI users/{user}/posts, and with the v1 prefix the full path is /v1/users/{user}/posts (the path parameter name is {user}).
- apiResource(...)->only('index') creates the index action route, which is an HTTP GET endpoint. Therefore GET is acceptable.
- In Laravel, a route defined for GET also accepts HEAD requests (the framework provides a HEAD route when a GET route exists), so HEAD is marked true.
- No other HTTP methods (POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS, TRACE) are registered for this endpoint by the shown route definition, so they are marked false.
- all HTTP methods acceptable is false because the route is specifically limited to the index (GET/HEAD) action.
